org.sat4j.reader

Class JSONReader<S extends ISolver>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sat4j.reader.Reader
      • org.sat4j.reader.JSONReader<S>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - the type of solver to feed.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JSONPBReader

    public class JSONReader<S extends ISolver>
extends Reader
    Simple JSON reader for clauses and cardinality constraints. Clauses are represented as an array of Dimacs literals (non zero integers). Cardinality constraints are represented like a clause for its left hand side, a comparator (a string) and a number. [[-1,-2,-3],[[1,-2,3],'>',2],[4,-3,6]] for instance represents three constraints, two clauses and the cardinality constraint x1 + not x2 + x3 > 2.
    Since:
    2.3.3
    Author:
    leberre

      • parseInstance

        public IProblem parseInstance(InputStream in)
                       throws ParseFormatException,
                              ContradictionException,
                              IOException
        Description copied from class: Reader
        Read a file from a stream. It is important to note that benchmarks are usually encoded in ASCII, not UTF8. As such, the only reasonable way to feed a solver from a stream is to use a stream.
        Specified by:
        parseInstance in class Reader
        Parameters:
        in - a stream containing the benchmark.
        Returns:
        the problem to solve (an ISolver in fact).
        Throws:
        ParseFormatException - if an error occurs during parsing.
        ContradictionException - if the problem is found trivially inconsistent.
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
